jobs.title: Customer Support Representative
jobs.description:
Providing an amazing support experience to our partners is a priority that WePay takes pride in doing. In fact, we’ve even won an award for Best Customer Service Department of the Year!

We’re looking for a caring and action-oriented advocate that can work autonomously to educate and assist the end users of our largest partners. It’s your chance to grow with a startup company as it expands to other countries, join a team of smart and fun people, and wake up on Monday mornings knowing that you’re going to be doing something meaningful.

A Day In the Life Includes (but is not limited to):

  • Assisting and educating customers primarily through phone, email and chat channels
  • Collaborating with the Engineering and Product teams to optimize our product
  • Developing policies and processes that will help scale our team
  • Cuddling with our office dog, Raja

Requirements:

  • Ability to manage time effectively and prioritize competing responsibilities
  • Strong business writing, verbal, and presentation skills
  • Interest in payments industry
  • Empathy and enthusiasm
  • Be agile and deal with ambiguity
  • Be relentlessly resourceful

WePay offers competitive salary & equity and a chance to help shape the future of the payments industry.  Other benefits include free breakfast/lunch, kitchen full of snacks/drinks, gym subsidy, medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, and 401k

jobs.title: API Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for a passionate API engineer to join our rapidly growing team and to support our rapid growth 

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership and make things happen
  • Create a stable, reliable and maintainable backend API with PHP and MySQL
  • Write, test and deploy production-ready code quickly and efficiently
  • Work closely with the team to design, implement and iterate features quickly

Requirements:

  • A passion for building stable, reliable and maintainable APIs
  • Knowledge of a variety of different languages and databases
  • Working knowledge of Web security
  • Experience working within the MVC design pattern
  • Experience building RESTful APIs
  • Helping developers use our API and maintain our SDKs
  • Write clean, maintainable code with unit tests and documentation
  • Enhancing and improving internal tools
  • Comfortable working in Linux

Ideal Candidate: 

  • Experience building apps with popular APIs such as Twitter, Facebook, PayPal or Google
  • Experience with online payments and fraud
  • Prior startup experience

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding software engineer who is passionate about creating cutting-edge platforms for payments and risk management.

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.   

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership and make things happen

  • Create stable, reliable and maintainable backend primarily with PHP and MySQL

  • Write, test and deploy production-ready code quickly and efficiently

  • Work closely with the team to design, implement and iterate features quickly

 

Requirements:

  • 2+ years working as a Backend Engineer

  • Expertise with one or more modern programming languages like Python, PHP, Java, Ruby or Scala

  • Knowledge of MySQL or other SQL databases

  • Experience working within the MVC design pattern

  • Comfortable working in Linux

  • Strong knowledge of Web security

  • B.S. or higher in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, etc.)

 

Ideal Candidate:

  • Experience with online payments and fraud

  • Linux system administration experience

  • Prior startup experience

jobs.title: Build & Release Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding Build & Release Engineer who is passionate about creating cutting-edge platforms for payments and risk management.

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers. WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk. WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud. 

 

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with developers and architects to refine build, test, and release practices across the organization.

Provide continuous support on builds and aim to make the build and releases as automated as possible.

Develop and maintain documentation of the build & release processes

Develop Jenkins jobs to help out QA, Deployments, automation.

 

Requirements:

B.S. or higher in a relevant technical field

A passion for designing and developing automated build and release management systems

Expert-level competency of Git & Github (merging, branching, best practices)

Expert-level competency of Bash and/or Python

Comfortable working with PHP & Java

Ability to think on your toes and wear many different hats 

 

Ideal Candidate: 

Has a strong desire to learn more and be motivated to complete tasks and find help when needed.

Is personable; builds strong working relationships with coworkers and

Has prior startup experience

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding software engineer who is passionate about creating cutting-edge platforms for payments and risk management.

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.   

Responsibilities:

  • Create stable, reliable and maintainable infrastructure primarily with PHP and MySQL

  • Automate our cloud infrastructure

  • Work closely with the team to design, implement and iterate features quickly

  • Develop and maintain Continuous Integration infrastructure

  • Take ownership and make things happen

Requirements:

  • Experience architecting components for a large-scale internet service

  • 1-2 years cloud storage experience—RackSpace preferred, Amazon EC2 / Vsphere OK

  • Experience querying and modifying SQL data

  • Experience with cloud computing philosophies and tools, ex: Chef, Ansible, Salt and Puppet

  • Experience using a monitoring frameworks such as Nagios or PagerDuty

  • Working knowledge of Web and system security

  • In-depth Linux knowledge, preferably CentOS

  • Working knowledge of MySQL server, Galera and Percona or Cassandra and MongoDB

Ideal Candidate:

  • Experience with online payments and fraud

  • PCI Level 1 compliance experience

  • Linux system administration

  • Prior startup experience

  • A passion for building stable, reliable, and maintainable backend environments

jobs.title: Lead Risk Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding engineering leader who is passionate about big data and wants to build cutting edge systems for fraud detection and risk management.

 

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.   

 

Responsibilities:

  • Build bigger data, better decisioning and smoother user experience into WePay’s Veda Risk Engine
  • Develop exemplary software and lead a small team of risk engineers
  • Make key decisions about the technical direction of the risk platform
  • Deploy rapidly on an independent risk service stack using Python and NoSQL databases
  • Lead development of systems in the following areas:
    • Clever methods for collecting data and extracting risk features
    • Scalable decisioning and control systems including rules engines and machine learning
    • Advanced tools for visualizing and investigating risk data
    • Third party integrations
    • Risk controls and remedies such as 2-factor authentication

 

Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience building risk, machine learning, data analytics, or other highly data-intensive systems
  • Demonstrated engineering leadership from both the technical and people perspective
  • Broad knowledge of software frameworks and tools
  • Ability to make key technical and architectural decisions
  • Strong software development practices
  • Expertise with one or more modern programming languages like Python, PHP, Java, Ruby or Scala
  • Strong knowledge of Web security
  • B.S. or higher in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, etc.)

jobs.title: Risk Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding software engineer who is passionate about big data and wants to build cutting edge systems for fraud detection and risk management.

 

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.   

 

Responsibilities:

  • Build bigger data, better decisioning and smoother user experience into WePay’s Veda Risk Engine
  • Deploy rapidly on an independent risk service stack using Python and NoSQL databases
  • Develop systems in one or more of the following areas:
    • Clever methods for collecting data and extracting risk features
    • Scalable decisioning and control systems including rules engines and machine learning
    • Advanced tools for visualizing and investigating risk data
    • Third party integrations
    • Risk controls and remedies such as 2-factor authentication

 

Requirements:

  • Proven experience building scalable systems with large amounts of data
  • Expertise with one or more modern programming languages like Python, PHP, Java, Ruby or Scala
  • Strong software development practices
  • Experience working within the MVC design pattern
  • Strong knowledge of Web security
  • Ability to act independently as needed for system set-up and management
  • B.S. or higher in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, etc.)

 

Ideal Candidate: 

  • Experience building risk, machine learning, rules engines, or advanced UI systems
  • Python, PHP experience

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for a passionate Software Development Engineer in Test to join our rapidly growing team and to support our ten-fold per year growth

Responsibilities:

  • Create test specifications, test cases and test estimates for new and existing products, then execute from start to finish.
  • Create and maintain test automation in Selenium/Ruby
  • Improve quality of product and process by interacting directly with developers and product management.
  • Continuously add new test cases and explore new ways to test product
  • Break down and solve complex interaction and technical problems.
  • Write scripts to automate API and UI testing

Requirements:

  • Experience with Windows/Mac operating systems as well as cross browser testing including mobile
  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently with minimum guidance
  • Self-starter and innovative. Push the boundaries of testing through the whole process
  • Forming deep partnerships with development, product  and customer teams
  • Agile/Scrum experience with both incremental and system testing
  • Strong logical, analytical, and troubleshooting skills, as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with customer testing and deployment
  • Passion for solving problems and identifying new ones
  • Ability to write test automation scripts from scratch. Experience with Selenium/Ruby rspec and scripting for API testing strongly preferred.

Ideal Candidate:

  • Experience with high volume Internet products
  • Programming experience with Java and Ruby rspec
  • Working knowledge of presentation technologies, including XHTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Multi-user Web Technology - UNIX ,HTML, HTTP, SSL

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for talented and motivated software engineers to join our rapidly expanding team. Our transaction volume has more than tripled year-over-year and we’re rapidly outgrowing our existing tech stack. We’re working to rebuild our application on top of a brand new service-oriented architecture and need your help. Do you love programming, take pride in the quality of your code, and are at least decent at ping pong? We want to talk to you! 

Requirements:

  • You have to be a great coder. We’re working with real money so writing efficient, maintainable and well tested code is a must. We believe that great coders can adapt to whatever programming language they need to, whether it’s Java, Python, PHP, Javascript, C++, Scala, Ruby, or whatever it is that’s hot this week.

  • You must be able to take complete ownership over a bug, feature, or entire project and drive it to completion. We have to trust that each of our team members can work independently because we hate micro-managing.

  • You must be open-minded, flexible, and have a pragmatic approach to solving problems. The payments industry can be baffling at times, so we value people who can persevere and continue to make progress with a positive attitude.

One or more of the following skills would be awesome:

  • Front-end expertise including: HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, AngularJS

  • Back-end expertise with RDBMS and NOSQL databases, messaging and queuing systems, batch and scheduled tasks 

  • Restful API design and implementation

  • Building highly available and distributed systems 

  • Big Data experience including Hadoop, Storm, Kafka, etc.

  • Machine Learning and Modeling

  • Experience in Risk and Fraud Detection 

  • Experience in payments and PCI compliance 

  • Expertise in Security 

  • Leadership experience

  • Prior open source experience, we love open source!

jobs.title: Human Resource Manager
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an outstanding Human Resource Manager who is energetic, organized, and looking to help build and take ownership of our Human Resources function.

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.   

Responsibilities:

  • Support programs that build and enhance our culture and measure employee engagement.
  • Manage compensation, benefits and payroll programs, including processing our bi-monthly payroll.
  • Support our recruiting team in scheduling interviews.  Draft offer letters to candidates, and manage and participate in onboarding new employees and processing resignations/terminations.
  • Support our performance management process.  Ensure that performance issues are addressed.
  • Update our compensation analysis annually using third party compensation data.
  • Prepare and maintain employment-related files.
  • Coordinate with our immigration attorney and support employees in the visa application/renewal process
  • Keep current on new compliance requirements.
  • Assist in the selection and implementation of a Human Resource Information System.
  • Coordinate company events.
  • Provide input on the Human Resources budget during our annual planning process.
  • Perform other Human Resource administrative responsibilities as required

Requirements:

  • Approximately 5 years of related experience in Human Resources.
  • Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Management, or related field.
  • Demonstrated experience in all aspects of Human Resources.
  • Ability to communicate and influence at all levels of the company, including executive management.
  • Innovative, driven, results-oriented with a record of achievement commensurate with previous experience.
  • Start-up industry experience preferred.

jobs.title: Lead Data Scientist - Risk
jobs.description:
WePay is looking for an exceptional data scientist to create new machine learning systems to detect payment fraud and merchant risk.   This role will contribute heavily to WePay’s risk management value proposition and competitive advantage.  

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.  You will find a highly data-rich environment and powerful risk data architecture from which to build machine learning systems.  

Responsibilities:

  • Build machine learning systems and models for detecting payment fraud, merchant fraud, and merchant risk 
  • Drive the complete lifecycle from data extraction through model deployment and evaluation 
  • Evaluate open source and third party tools 
  • Provide requirements to engineering team to enhance machine learning capabilities
  • Collaborate closely with engineering and risk teams
  • Assist in hiring other outstanding data scientists
  • Write feature extraction code for new model variables 
  • Gather training data
  • Train machine learning models (this includes selecting and setting up the Python libraries for ML algorithms, etc)
  • Evaluate model performance
  • Deploy feature extraction & models in production with help from engineering as needed (ideally the help needed from other engineers will be smaller over time)

Requirements:

  • 4+ years experience in applied machine learning / model development 
  • M.S. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical field (computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • In-depth understanding of machine learning and modeling algorithms such as decision trees, random forest, neural networks, naïve Bayesian, SVM, etc.  
  • Technical expertise in data extraction, data scrubbing, feature extraction, model building / training, and statistical analysis
  • Proficiency in databases (SQL, NoSQL), statistical tools (R, SAS, etc), and programming languages (Python, PHP, Ruby, Java, etc)
  • Collaborative, team player who drives to resolving customer needs
  • Outstanding track record of innovation and success

WePay is a company with a great open, supportive culture that cares deeply about employees and customers.   We are empowering a whole new bottom-up economy of commerce and community and having fun doing so.  WePay has a strong culture and benefits – examples include free lunch every day, yearly company summer offsite, yearly blow-out Hallowepay party.

jobs.title: Risk Analyst
jobs.description:
The Risk Analyst is responsible for managing and mitigating the risk involved in WePay’s payment processing including review and investigation of potentially risky payments as well as the handling of fraudulent payments, accounts and users.

Requirements:

3-5 years experience in risk analysis and mitigation (preferably in the payments industry)
Strong critical thinking and deduction skills
Experience gathering and sifting through information with a sharp eye for detail
Ability to solve puzzles and infer solutions from limited information
Experience in spotting trends and building processes to counteract them
Ability to maintain calm under pressure


Responsibilites:

Manual transaction review
Investigation of accounts, users and payments
Assist in building and tweaking automated fraud engine rules
Work with fraud victims to recover funds and provide information and support
Work with departments to determine if potential customers comply with the WePay Terms of Service
Handle chargeback recovery and reporting
Interact with users whose payments require further information or investigation

jobs.title: Account Executive - Mid Market
jobs.description:
The WePay Mid-Market Team is responsible for executing across a wide range of responsibilities including investigating opportunities, developing relationships, managing integration processes, and growing accounts. You will be provided with guidance, training and support while working effectively in a fast paced environment.

This is a unique opportunity for an accomplished individual to join a fast growing product within an equally exciting start-up company.

Responsibilities:

* Identify and qualify opportunities via inbound leads and outbound prospecting.
* Develop add-on business with existing accounts
* Be the voice of your customer via product feedback to internal teams
* Work partnerships from beginning to end with little to no supervision
* Negotiate pricing and terms with partner to encourage the close of the sale

Qualifications:

* 3-5 years in a solution sales role, ideally with high-growth technology company
* Experience in negotiating commercial and high-value relationships
* Demonstrated track record in meeting and exceeding quotas
* Organized, detail oriented and strong multi-tasking ability
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Results oriented and constantly looking for self-improvement

jobs.title: Director of Enterprise Sales
jobs.description:
Responsibilities include:

  • Own the new business revenue number for the entire company 

  • Establish and manage sales activity within the platform market 

  • Sales management duties including coaching, motivating, mentoring of sales team

  • Identify new products and market opportunities to fuel the team's growth. 

  • Work with other senior executives to identify, recommend, develop, implement and support strategic sales and marketing objectives. Must be able to perform   both management and individual contributor roles of the business.

  • Develop annual sales and marketing strategic business plans to drive revenue and increase market share.

  • Work with the finance team to determine quarterly forecasts

  • Assess market potential and identify new business opportunities.

  • Identify and target new clients and markets

  • Work with marketing to improve and track lead gen efforts

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree required

  • 8-10 years enterprise sales experience, 3-5 years management experience

  • Work history must show solid tenures in the B2B Industry or enterprise space

  • Working knowledge of Salesforce and ability to ternate reports 

  • Timely decision maker, able to prioritize critical tasks that add the highest value. Ability to build relationships and work well across functions

  • Superior written and verbal communications, decision-making, problem-solving and organizational skills essential

jobs.title: Sales Development Associate
jobs.description:
About Us:

The Business Development / Sales team is responsible for executing across a wide range of responsibilities including investigating opportunities, developing relationships, managing integration processes, and growing partnerships. You will be provided with guidance, training and support while working effectively in a fast paced environment.

This is a unique opportunity for an accomplished individual to join a fast growing product within an equally exciting start-up company. The position also provides an opportunity to be promoted to a Partnerships & Business Development position in 12-18 months.

Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert on the WePay product, payments landscape, and target verticals
  • Identify key decision makers, generate interest and develop opportunities for the Partnerships & Business Development team
  • Pass off opportunities to the appropriate Business Development executive during an introductory call
  • Respond to inbound inquiries generated by website and email marketing campaigns
  • Manage and track prospecting pipeline via Salesforce
  • Work closely with Marketing and Sales Operations to refine the process for lead generation and lead nurturing

Requirements:

  • 1-2 years experience in a Sales development or prospecting role
  • Competitive, ambitious and resourceful sales hunters
  • Natural salespeople with charming, winning interpersonal skills
  • Interesting, outgoing, and dedicated people who enjoy being part of a small, growing team
  • Tech-savvy individuals with an understanding of the startup landscape
  • Creative, intelligent and focused on self-improvement and growth

Perks:

WePay is a fast-growing company with a great open, supportive culture that cares deeply about employees and customers.  We are empowering a whole new bottom-up economy of commerce and community and having fun doing so.  WePay has a strong culture and benefits – examples include free lunch every day, fully stocked kitchen, subsidized Equinox membership, yearly weekend offsite, and an incredible yearly blow-out HalloWepay party.

jobs.title: Senior Account Manager
jobs.description:
WePay is hiring a Senior Account Manager to support its platform partners.  The successful applicant will be a passionate, curious, self-starter with demonstrated success in helping the customers of a technology company achieve their goals with the company's products.  They will have consistently hit revenue targets from existing customers.

Responsibilities

  • Manage relationships with a named list of key customers.
  • Develop annual and quarterly engagement and revenue plans for each customer.
  • Serve as a source of knowledge for the customer about the WePay API and associated tools.
  • Maintain a list of open issues and upcoming goals with customers, project manage goal attainment and issue resolution, and conduct regular communication with customers about these issues and goals.
  • Track WePay performance towards key metrics and report on performance to WePay and customers.

Qualifications

  • 5 years or more of Account Management experience in a technology company.
  • Glowing customer and company references.
  • Demonstrated passion and curiosity.
  • Proven record of accomplishment from personal initiative.
  • Strong data aptitude and analytical skills.
  • Bachelors degree required.  Post graduate work is a plus.

About WePay

WePay is a fast-growing payments company that has built its API specifically for platform businesses like marketplaces, crowdfunding sites and small business software. Through this API, WePay allows platforms to easily offer payments to their buyers and sellers.  WePay uniquely offers platforms a customized user experience while shielding them from fraud risk.  WePay’s proprietary Veda risk technology leverages alternate data sources such as social media, platform data, and traditional business data to detect and mitigate fraud.

jobs.title: Recruiter
jobs.description:
WePay is seeking our first inhouse recruiter to help build our team.  We are looking for someone who wants to have a huge impact by helping find & select future WePayers.  We are seeking experienced candidates for a full-time position (or contract to full-time).

Responsibilities:

  • Own all aspects of the candidate funnel from sourcing to close
  • Help manage WePay's hiring process
  • Drive recruiment standardization across WePay
  • Help develop recruiting materials & messaging
  • Report on our recruiting performance & effectiveness
  • Foster a culture of recruiting

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of recruiting experience
  • Technical recruiting experience
  • Exceptional interpersonal & communication skills
  • One of a kind hustle & enthusiasm

WePay offers competitive salary & equity and a chance to help shape the future of the payments industry.  Other benefits include medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401k, free lunch & a fitness subsidy.

Please, no external recruiting firms need apply.
